titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ethel Fogg and William Brooks Clift Memorial Collection
Clift (Ethel Fogg and William Brooks) Memorial Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Ruth Gay

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 07:28

did.unittitle: Ethel Fogg and William Brooks Clift memorial collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: A collection assembled by John M. Whitcomb of the letters and other papers of European and American cultural and political figures from the eighteenth to the twentieth centuries. With the collection is the correspondence (1948-1989) of John M. Whitcomb with writers, historians and political figures on subjects such as the Russian Revolution, Communism, the Sacco-Vanzetti case, Woodrow Wilson, and American foreign policy. Also included is biographical material relating to Ethel Fogg Blair and William Brooks Clift, parents of actor Montgomery Clift.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ethel Fogg and William Brooks Clift Memorial Collection (MS 817). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Clift Collection is divided into three series. Series I consists of letters and other papers of European and American cultural and political figures from the eighteenth through the twentieth centuries. These papers are arranged alphabetically by author. Series II contains the correspondence of John Merrall Whitcomb (1907-, Y. 1930) with writers, historians, and political figures on subjects such as the Russian Revolution, communism, the Sacco-Venzetti case, Woodrow Wilson, and American foreign policy. These papers are arranged alphabetically by correspondent. Series III consists of material relating to Ethel Fogg Clift.

Yale University received this collection through the generosity of John M. Whitcomb, who donated the papers in honor of Ethel Blair Fogg Clift and William Brooks Clift in a series of gifts beginning in 1975.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
